title: Quick Install
summary: Quick Install: Run the provided command to get started. Prerequisites include Java, Python, and Windows Subsystem if running Windows. Instructions are provided for installing Java and Python. For Windows, the document recommends enabling the Linux Subsystem. A Docker Compose configuration is provided to run an Ergo blockchain node, with instructions to start and monitor the node.

qa_pairs.answer: Java, Python, and Windows Subsystem if running Windows

sections.heading: Quick Install
sections.content:
Run the following command to get started

```bash
bash -c "$(curl -s https://node.phenotype.dev)"
```
source available on [GitHub](https://github.com/glasgowm148/ergoscripts)

sections.heading: Prerequisities
sections.content:
- Java
- Python
- Windows Subsystem if running Windows

sections.heading: Java
sections.content:
```bash
curl -s "https://get.sdkman.io" | bash
sdk install java
```

Java 11 is recommended.

sections.heading: Ubuntu
sections.content:
sudo apt update && upgrade
sudo apt install python3 python3-pip ipython3

sections.heading: Windows
sections.content:
See [this guide](https://www.windowscentral.com/install-windows-subsystem-linux-windows-10) or run this command in your terminal. This will enable the *Linux Subsystem* and allow you to execute as Linux. 

```bash
Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux 
```

sections.heading: Docker Compose
sections.content:
```yaml
version: "3.8"

services:
  # Ergo blockchain node
  node:
    image: ergoplatform/ergo
    container_name: mn-ergo-node
    command: --mainnet -c /etc/ergo.conf
    volumes:
      - ./.ergo:/home/ergo/.ergo
      - ./ergo.conf:/etc/ergo.conf:ro
    ports:
      - 9053:9053
      - 9030:9030
    restart: unless-stopped
    # Increase or decrease the max heap value as required
    environment:
        - MAX_HEAP=4G
    logging:
      options:
        max-size: "10m"
        max-file: "3"
```

Run the node with

```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

Follow the logs with

```bash
docker logs -f ergo-mainnet -n 200
```
